org.jasig.cas.adaptors.duo

Class DuoAuthenticationHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jasig.cas.authentication.AbstractAuthenticationHandler
      • org.jasig.cas.authentication.handler.support.AbstractPreAndPostProcessingAuthenticationHandler
        • org.jasig.cas.adaptors.duo.DuoAuthenticationHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AuthenticationHandler

    @Component(value="duoAuthenticationHandler")
public final class DuoAuthenticationHandler
extends AbstractPreAndPostProcessingAuthenticationHandler
    Authenticate CAS credentials against Duo Security.
    Since:
    4.2

    • Method Detail

      • doAuthentication

        protected HandlerResult doAuthentication(Credential credential)
                                  throws java.security.GeneralSecurityException,
                                         PreventedException
        Do an out of band request using the DuoWeb api (encapsulated in DuoAuthenticationService) to the hosted duo service. If it is successful it will return a String containing the username of the successfully authenticated user, but if not - will return a blank String or null.
        Specified by:
        doAuthentication in class AbstractPreAndPostProcessingAuthenticationHandler
        Parameters:
        credential - Credential to authenticate.
        Returns:
        the result of this handler
        Throws:
        java.security.GeneralSecurityException - general security exception for errors
        PreventedException - authentication failed exception

      • supports

        public boolean supports(Credential credential)
        Description copied from interface: AuthenticationHandler
        Determines whether the handler has the capability to authenticate the given credential. In practical terms, the AuthenticationHandler.authenticate(Credential) method MUST be capable of processing a given credential if supports returns true on the same credential.
        Parameters:
        credential - The credential to check.
        Returns:
        True if the handler supports the Credential, false otherwise.
